Items.Description: A trick; an act of cheating somebody
A lettuce of a variety with crisp narrow leaves that form a tall head
A small bed with high barred sides for a baby or very young child
A wound caused by something sharp
A pub, typically one in the country, in some cases providing accommodation
An atom or molecule with a net electric charge due to the loss or gain of one or more electrons
A member of a religious community of women, typically one living under vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience
A fruit consisting of a hard or tough shell around an edible kernel
(in fantasy literature and games) a member of an imaginary race of humanlike creatures, characterized as ugly, warlike, and malevolent
Same as decay
Move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time
A long, deep track made by the repeated passage of the wheels of vehicles
An immoral act considered to be a transgression against divine law
Used as a polite or respectful way of addressing a man, especially one in a position of authority
A boy or man in relation to either or both of his parents
The star round which the earth orbits
A silvery-white metal, the chemical element of atomic number 50
A small songbird that searches acrobatically for insects among foliage and branches
A unit of weight equal to 2,240 lb avoirdupois (1016.05 kg)
A young child
A tall, rounded vase with a stem and base, especially one used for storing the ashes of a cremated person
A flat disc or piece of metal with an official stamp, used as money
Plants, such as wheat, maize, oats, and barley, that can be used to produce flour
(of an object or action) require the payment of (a specified sum of money) before it can be acquired or done
A famous person or thing that people admire and see as a symbol of a particular idea, way of life, etc.
A strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, the chemical element of atomic number 26, much used as a material for construction and manufacturing, especially in the form of steel
A genre of film or literature characterized by bleakness, moral ambiguity, and crime.
Twelve o'clock in the middle of the day, or about that time
A Japanese edible seaweed eaten either fresh or dried
A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
Something that is one's duty or responsibility
A violent disturbance of the peace by a crowd
The part of a plant which attaches it to the ground or to a support, typically underground, conveying water and nourishment to the rest of the plant via numerous branches and fibres
The physical destruction or disintegration of something or the state of disintegrating or being destroyed
The smallest member of a litter
A reddish- or yellowish-brown flaking coating of iron oxide that is formed on iron or steel by oxidation, especially in the presence of moisture
A deep black powdery or flaky substance consisting largely of amorphous carbon, produced by the incomplete burning of organic matter
A category of things or people with a common feature; a type
A drink made by mixing a spirit with lemon or lime juice.
A set of outer clothes made of the same fabric and designed to be worn together, typically consisting of a jacket and trousers or a jacket and skirt
A shade or variety of a colour
A short, sharp sound from a horn
A wrongful act or an infringement of a right (other than under contract) leading to legal liability
A journey for pleasure in which several different places are visited
A set or group of three people or things
Move in a circular direction wholly or partly round an axis or point
An individual thing or person regarded as single and complete but which can also form an individual component of a larger or more complex whole
Determine the total number of (a collection of items)
A body of people presided over by a judge, judges, or magistrate, and acting as a tribunal in civil and criminal cases
The tough outer part of a loaf of bread
An introduction
Short for nitroglycerine
A swollen edible bulb used as a vegetable, having a pungent taste and smell and composed of several concentric layers
A wandering samurai who had no lord or master, in Feudal Japan
A place where birds regularly settle or congregate to rest at night, or where bats congregate to rest in the day
A solid form of resin obtained from pines and some other plants.
A young shoot or twig of a plant, especially one cut for grafting or rooting
A feeling and expression of contempt or disdain for someone or something
The action of scouring or the state of being scoured, especially by swift-flowing water.
A soldier or other person sent out ahead of a main force so as to gather information about the enemy's position, strength, or movements
An explosive sound made by the sudden forcing of breath through one's nose, used to express indignation, derision, or incredulity
The projecting nose and mouth of an animal, especially a mammal
A person who can endure pain or hardship without showing their feelings or complaining
​strong dark beer made with malt or barley
A rod or bar forming part of a framework and designed to resist compression
Inhibit growth or development.
A medicinal substance taken to give a feeling of vigour or well-being
The trunk of the human body
A fish that lives in rivers and lakes, or lives in the sea but returns to rivers to produce its eggs
Firm belief in the reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something
A loose garment, typically sleeveless and reaching to the knees, as worn in ancient Greece and Rome
A teacher who teaches a child outside of school
The action of joining together or the fact of being joined together, especially in a political context
A travelling company of acrobats, clowns, and other entertainers which gives performances, typically in a large tent, in a series of different places
A shrubby asian tree bearing fruits which resemble large lemons with less acid flesh and thick fragrant peel
A tree of a genus that includes citron, lemon, lime, orange, and grapefruit. Native to Asia, there trees are cultivated in warm countries for their fruit
A plant grown in warm countries for the soft white hairs around its seeds that are used to make cloth and thread
A relative who is the son or daughter of one's parent's sibling.
A small spring-flowering Eurasian plant of the iris family, which grows from a corm and bears bright yellow, purple, or white flowers
A conception of or belief about something
(disapproving or humorous) ​a person who lives in or comes from the country
Fine plaster used for coating wall surfaces or moulding into architectural decorations
Assistance and support in times of hardship and distress.
A man who pursues a relationship with a particular woman, with a view to marriage
Simultaneous performance or utterance of action or speech
The large oval brown seed of a tropical palm, consisting of a hard woody husk surrounded by fibre, lined with edible white flesh and containing a clear liquid
An outline representing or bounding the shape or form of something
A small piece of fried or toasted bread served with soup or used as a garnish
An Italian dish of rice cooked in stock with ingredients such as vegetables and meat or seafood
A hot wind, often dusty or rainy, blowing from North Africa across the Mediterranean to southern Europe.
​the process of removing air or liquid from a space or container so that something else can be taken into it or so that two surfaces can stick together
The action of twisting or the state of being twisted, especially of one end of an object relative to the other
A person who is travelling or visiting a place for pleasure
A mythical animal typically represented as a horse with a single straight horn projecting from its forehead
